comments:
Build ID: M20060629-1905

Steps To Reproduce:
1. File -> New -> Other... -> Mylar -> Query
2. Select JIRA repository
3. Select "Create query using form"
On next it causes the exception stack.

If I open the JIRA repository properties and click "Validate Settings" it tells me it can login successfully.

If at 3. I select "Use parameters from saved filter" and choose an existing query from the list then the query is added to the Task List but it fails to synchronize. Logging directly into JIRA I can see these queries have problems attached to them. There is nothing in the error log to indicate that the query failed, and no obvious way to preview the results of the query.

This JIRA repository is not behind a proxy.

When I try to reproduce the problem against http://jira.atlassian.com I get an error because Mylar does not appear to be using my proxy settings in Eclipse. Being behind an NTLM proxy makes things worse but the Eclipse web browser and other plugins are able to retrieve internet web pages correctly.

More information:
JIRA: Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.3.2-#98

eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.5.0_10
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_AU
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data D:\ide\mcp

For the proxy configuration and server requirements see wiki at http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#JIRA_Connector
Not sure if that would work for NTLM auth, but you can try. We hope to align JIRA proxy support with other connectors the near future.
Unfortunately 3.3.2 is currently not supported (although the Mylar homepage states otherwise). JIRA versions 3.6 and later should work.
*** Bug 174566 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have successfully run queries and created tasks against a JIRA 3.3.3 repository therefore I deem that the minimum requirement for Mylar.

Mik, could you replace any reference to 3.1.1 on the web site to 3.3.3 and close this report?
Done for download page and FAQ.
